other_tests.findings: Initial ECG showed sinus rhythm at a rate of 60 beats per minute, with premature atrial complexes and nonspecific ST-segment and T-wave changes. A repeat ECG during severe chest pain showed ST-segment elevation in leads II, III, aVF, V5, and V6, and ST-segment depression in leads I, aVR, aVL, V1, V2, and V3.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Subsequent ECGs showed normalization of ST segments, followed by transient ST-segment elevations in the absence of pain.

other_tests.findings: Revealed a right-dominant system with mild diffuse disease in the proximal and middle segments of the right coronary artery, a 30% ostial stenosis of the posterior descending artery, and a 90% focal proximal stenosis in the posterolateral ventricular branch.
other_tests.changes_over_time: After stent placement, there were excellent angiographic results and normal flow with no residual stenosis.

other_tests.findings: Showed excellent exercise tolerance, without evidence of ischemia or infarction.
